entities: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports at least twice a year
summary:
The Security Council:

1. Extends the mandate of MINURSO until 30 April 2013.

2. Reaffirms the need for full respect of military agreements with MINURSO regarding the ceasefire.

3. Calls on parties to cooperate with MINURSO operations and ensure security and unhindered movement for UN personnel.

4. Welcomes parties' commitment to informal talks in preparation for a fifth round of negotiations.

5. Calls on parties to show political will and work towards a more intensive phase of negotiations to achieve a solution.

6. Supports the Secretary-General's commitment to a solution and calls for intensified meetings and contacts.

7. Calls on parties to continue negotiations under the Secretary-General's auspices without preconditions and in good faith.

8. Invites Member States to assist these talks.

9. Requests the Secretary-General to brief the Council regularly on negotiations and MINURSO's operations.

10. Welcomes parties' commitment to periodic meetings with the UN High Commissioner for Refugees to review confidence-building measures.

11. Urges Member States to provide voluntary contributions to fund confidence-building measures.

12. Requests the Secretary-General to ensure MINURSO's compliance with the UN's zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation and abuse.

13. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
